content: In the following questions, I will provide you with a graph (given as an array of nodes and an array of edges), a starting point, and a target point. Please return the shortest path from the starting point to the target point in the following format: 1->2->3->4... Please note that your answer should only include the result in this format and should not contain any other words.(Notice that for the same graph, if the start and end points of the problem are swapped, the new shortest path should be the reverse of the original shortest path.)

The shortest path from node 10 to node 4 is:

4->8->3->4

Remember that if the start and end points of the problem are swapped, the new shortest path should be the reverse of the original shortest path. In this case, the shortest path from node 4 to node 10 would be:

4->3->8->4

Please note that these are the shortest paths in the graph, and they may include more than one edge.

The shortest path from node 4 to node 10 is:

4->3->8->10

Remember that if the start and end points of the problem are swapped, the new shortest path should be the reverse of the original shortest path. In this case, the shortest path from node 10 to node 4 would be:

10->8->3->4

Please note that these are the shortest paths in the graph, and they may include more than one edge.
